Francisca Oboh-Ikuenobe bụ onyea nyoputa ụwa na ala si Ubiaja dị na Esan South East Local Government Area nke Edo State. Ọ bụ ọkachamara na palynology na sedimentology, ọ bụkwa Ọkà mmụta nke Geology na Ngalaba nke Geosciences na Geological na Petroleum na Injinia, bụkwara Associate Dean of Academic Affairs na College of Engineering and Computing, Missouri University of Science and Technology.

Maria Goretti Girls Grammer di na Benin-city, Naijiria. O nwetara BSc ntulugo nke mbụ na geology na afọ1983, mgbe nke ahụ gasịrị ọ rụrụ ọrụ dị ka onye na-ahụ maka mmepụta ihe dị na  ala na Shell Petroleum Development Company nke Nigeria na Lagos, na palynologist na Shell na ụlọ nyocha ha dị na Warri Delta State, tupu ọ laghachi n'ụlọ akwụkwọ gụsịrị akwụkwọ maka MSc ya na applied geology na 1987, na Mahadum Ife Nigeria (nke bụzi Mahadum Obafemi Awolowo)
Mgbe nke a gasịrị, ọ nọ n'ọkwa dị ka onye enyemaka nkuzi na Mahadum Ife

E nyere ya Commonwealth Scholarship Commission Award maka nzere doctorate ya na Ngalaba Sayensị Ụwa, Mahadum Cambridge (New Hall, ugbu a Murray Edwards College), nke e nyere na 1991 na thesis ya 'Palaeoenvironmental Reconstruction of the E2.0 Reservoir in the Kolo Creek Field, Niger Delta (Nigeria)'
Ọ sonyeere Missouri S&T, mgbe ahụ Ngalaba nke Geology na Geophysics na 1991 dị ka osote prọfesọ na geology.

Her research falls under the categories of palynology and sedimentology, with the former including studies of pollen and other palynomorphs within sediments and sedimentary rocks as a proxy for biostratigraphic, palaeoecological and palaeoclimatic reconstructions. She also integrates palynofacies with organic geochemistry.
